short_description: opera queens is a theatre based in canada.
long_description: based primarily in montréal and toronto with a growing number of american and other international board members and artists, new commissions include when daylight rises and re-imagined overtures to samson et dalila and adriana lecouvreur by morgan-paige melbourne. other projects included tanya's secret , a queer reworking of tchaikovsky's eugene onegin fundraising for kyiv pride ; a live-streamed chez pauline viardot recital; live and filmed productions of drama queens featuring opera scenes of history, myth, and legend; as well as latin night on latinx and hispanx identity, centred on the canadian première of these wings are meant to fly (sérpa & kline), an opera on the pulse orlando tragedy. initiatives such as the opéra queens podcast s potlight queer and/or ibpoc artists and their allies with conversations taking audiences behind the stage through conversations on race, representation, and transcending heteronormativity and colonization in the operatic canon. opera in full colour: majority lgbtq+ and/or bipoc.
business_tags: social sciences & humanities | performances and events | school of music | history & myth | artistic directors | ballet school | chamber music | vocal music | theatre | myths & legends | hair colour | international board | it services
generated_description: opéra queens is a non-profit organization based in montreal, quebec, founded in fall 2020 by artistic director mike fan. the organization presents classical vocal music with a focus on inclusivity, featuring majority lgbtq+ and bipoc+ artists in drag, gender-bent, and queerified performances. opéra queens collaborates with various institutions and artists from canada, the united states, and international locations. the organization's projects include new commissions, live-streamed performances, and productions that explore diverse themes such as race, representation, and the operatic canon. opéra queens has received significant funding from various arts councils and organizations, and it continues to engage in initiatives that promote diversity and inclusivity in the arts.
